sections.1_story_intuition: Sports is a popular topic in competitive exams, covering major games, tournaments, awards, and personalities. Knowing key facts about sports helps in scoring well in the GK section. This section covers important sports, Indian and international achievements, and exam-relevant facts.
2_key_definitions: Sport: Physical activity or game with rules, played for enjoyment or competition.
Olympics: International multi-sport event held every four years.
World Cup: Major international tournament in various sports.
National Game: Official sport of a country.
Medal: Award for achievement in sports.
Trophy: Prize awarded to winners of tournaments.
Record: Highest achievement in a sport.
Player: Person who participates in a sport.
Stadium: Place where sports are played.
3_key_facts_data_points: Asian Games started in 1951, New Delhi.
Sachin Tendulkar: Most runs in international cricket.
Neeraj Chopra: Olympic gold in javelin (2021).
Rohit Sharma: Highest individual ODI score (264).
Roger Federer: Tennis Grand Slam champion.
Dronacharya Award: For best coaches in India.
Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna: Highest sports honor in India.
Arjuna Award: For outstanding athletes in India.
5_exam_capsules: What is India's national game? Hockey.
Who is known as Flying Sikh? Milkha Singh.
Who won Olympic gold in javelin? Neeraj Chopra.
Who is the highest run scorer in cricket? Sachin Tendulkar.
Who is a world boxing champion? Mary Kom.
When did Cricket World Cup start? 1975.
When did FIFA World Cup start? 1930.
Who won Olympic silver in badminton? P.V. Sindhu.
Who is the hockey legend? Major Dhyan Chand.
Who has the highest ODI score? Rohit Sharma.
Who is the fastest man? Usain Bolt.
Who is a tennis Grand Slam champion? Roger Federer.
What is the oldest tennis tournament? Wimbledon.
What is the highest sports honor in India? Khel Ratna.
7_traps_confusing_points: Confusing India's national game (Hockey) with Cricket.
Mixing up Olympic and Commonwealth Games.
Assuming all World Cups are for cricket.
Confusing Khel Ratna and Arjuna Awards.
Mixing up FIFA and ICC World Cups.
Assuming all tennis Grand Slams are in England.
Confusing Asian Games and Commonwealth Games.
Mixing up years of first World Cups.

8_case_study_context.title: Neeraj Chopra's Olympic Gold
8_case_study_context.explanation: Neeraj Chopra won India's first Olympic gold in athletics (javelin throw) at Tokyo 2021. His achievement inspired millions and marked a historic moment in Indian sports history.
